entry.title: Today the area encompassing 20th, 21st, 22nd, Market, Blake, and...
entry.content:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

Today the area encompassing 20th, 21st, 22nd, Market, Blake, and Wazee was SWEPT. Many of these residents moved to this area after the Arkins SWEEP. There were approximately 75+ people living there. One woman was tied down to a stretcher and taken by ambulance clearly against her consent. Then all of her belongings were trashed. One resident had her tents trashed while she was moving some of her belongings to the fence line as community volunteers are still being denied entry... into the fenced area. While volunteers and advocates were busy providing food, drink, supplies, and moving folks from 20th, 21st, Market and Blake, one man stood alone against 7 officers on 22nd and Wazee. Eventually, he was forced to move. Advocates arrived to witness the last tent which was unoccupied being trashed by DOTI.

And the City just keeps on SWEEPING. Tomorrow a SWEEP is posted for 7th and Lincoln. Another SWEEP is posted for Tuesday December 15, 2020 at 4th and Kalamath, the same day as our court hearing.

This insanity must stop!

Wanna get involved? Tomorrow DDPHE will have a public comment session. DDPHE is the Denver Department of Public Health one of the lead agencies in conducting SWEEPS. These are the guys who declare a public site as hazardous. Sign up at: https://www.denvergov.org/…/boa…/general-public-comment.html

See More

entry.title: THREE Sweeps This Week - Pushing the Same People Block to...
entry.content:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

THREE Sweeps This Week - Pushing the Same People Block to Block...

THREE sweeps are scheduled for next week. The City is clearly trying to get as many sweeps as possible in before our lawsuit hearing the following week.

13th and Elati is also posted for a sweep next Tuesday, December 8th. This camp has roughly 50 people and is about half made up of people who moved there from the downtown library sweep a couple weeks ago.

...

21st,20th, Market, Blake and Wazee from 22nd to Park Ave is scheduled for Wednesday, December 9th. This encampment made up of people who were swept from 22nd and Wazze a couple weeks ago and from Arkins this week. Now the City plans to sweep them again...to some other block to be swept again...

7th and Lincoln is scheduled for a sweep on Thursday December 10th. This encampment moved one block from the other side of 7 news a few weeks ago after a sweep.

Please come and support our unhoused community members at 13th and Elati on Tuesday, 21st and Market and Blake on Wednesday, and 7th and Lincoln on Thursday as they demand real housing or places where they are allowed to survive.

Bring the following things to assist residents:
-Truck, or any vehicle to help move
-Carts
-Bungee Cords
-Rope
-Trash Bags
-Food
-Coffee/CoCo
-Water

Your assistance is much appreciated! Somewhere around 6:30am and all morning help will likely be needed.

Toward Rights, Dignity and Housing…
Contact:
info@denverhomelessoutloud.org
720-940-5291

See More

entry.title: Only took 10 months... to get permission. To put tents in neat...
entry.content:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

Only took 10 months... to get permission.
To put tents in neat rows socially distanced rows
with a couple of port-a-potty.

Hope the city doe not call the port-a-potty company to remove then like they do with ones at unsanctioned camps. Those port-a-potties meet the same health need in either case.

...

We need about 50 of these to meet the need and after nerly a year we have 1.

https://denverite.com/…/denvers-first-temporary-sanctione…/…

entry.title: "If you’re going to make decisions, and make decisions...
entry.content:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

"If you’re going to make decisions, and make decisions that are against public-health guidance, you’re going to have to answer for those decisions," McNulty says

McNulty doesn't buy it. "I find it hypocritical that Hancock is using the pandemic as some sort of shield to testify, when just two weeks ago he was flying across the country for Thanksgiving," he says.
----------

...

The same mayor who is to busy to see the federal Judge on the sweeps case
during business hours with a job he can delegate day to day stuff to.. has plenty of thine to fly out of state to visit family when he tell everyone else to stay put. Time to face the Music nasty man. Perhaps he is so use to lying that he knows he will lie in front of the Judge and that would lead to serous consequences. Like contempt of court charges. We already know the Judge is not happy with the cities attitude in this case as the Judge stated during testimony in the Lyall vs Denver case. You are not going to be able to order around the Federal Judge the way you do the city attorney.

https://www.westword.com/…/colorado-governor-denver-mayor-t…

See MoreThe case has a hearing this month.

westword.com

Hancock, Polis Try to Avoid Testifying in Homeless-Sweeps Lawsuit

The case has a hearing this month.The case has a hearing this month.

entry.title: THE WOMEN'S VILLAGE @ CLARA BROWN COMMONS IS OPEN!!!
entry.content:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

THE WOMEN'S VILLAGE @ CLARA BROWN COMMONS IS OPEN!!!

+2Colorado Village Collaborative

THE WOMEN'S VILLAGE @ CLARA BROWN COMMONS IS OPEN!!!

Yesterday, the first residents spent the night in this brand new cluster of 14 tiny homes, which make up De...nver's second tiny home village. One resident reported spending the previous night in a stairwell. Another resident reported spending the previous night in an abandoned warehouse.

Now these women are held in the warmth, security, and stability of shelter and community. On this new morning, the process of healing from past traumas begins.

Since passing zoning code changes in October 2019 that made room for Temporary Tiny Home Villages all throughout the city, the number of tiny homes in Denver has tripled from 11 units to 33 units in just one year.

Today we celebrate! Tomorrow we move forward to realize our collective goal of shelter, community, stability, health, and housing for all.

See More

entry.title: We have an access number you can call to listen to the hearing...
entry.content:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

We have an access number you can call to listen to the hearing for the lawsuit against the sweeps December 15th and 16th at 9am!

For public audio access to the hearing, please call 877-336-1828 and enter access code 9449909#.

Social Distanced Press Conference and Breakfast Tuesday December 15th at 8am before the hearing at 20th and Champa.

...

Hearing for Injunction to Stop Sweeps Set for Dec 15th and 16th

On December 15th and 16th, 2020, Federal District 10 Judge Martinez will be hearing our case against the City of Denver and the State of Colorado for violating constitutional rights by sweeping people without homes and with nowhere to go - even in a global pandemic. This suit demands that sweeps be halted, at least during the COVID pandemic, to protect the health and safety of the community with and without housing - as in line with CDC guidance. The suit states, “The CDC issued this guidance because conducting sweeps significantly increases the risk to homeless individuals, and the community, of infection with COVID-19. Despite this clear warning, the defendants chose to act in direct contradiction of public health guidance and to violate the property and due process rights of homeless individuals in a cruel and dangerous manner.”

On top of this the suit addresses that, “Over the past year, and in a blatant effort to skirt a settlement agreement entered into between Denver and a class of its homeless population, Denver officials have repeatedly showed up at homeless encampments without notice, flatly told homeless residents to move along (“to where?” is the obvious question to this nonsensical command), and seized their property (often discarding it).” The City cannot get away with these violations of the lawsuit settlement agreement nor with the blatant disregard for the health of those who can’t afford housing during this pandemic.

Plaintiffs for this case lost all their property in sweeps, including a mass sweep of Lincoln Park conducted by the City and State together on July 29th, 2020 with no notice. One plaintiff, Charles explains how after gathering all he could in one trip to move from the park that morning, that “when I returned to the spot where my tent had been, I found that it had been taken and destroyed by Denver officials, along with everything in it.” Hundreds of people lost all their property in that one sweep. These same hundreds of people have been chased around the City in sweep after sweep since that time.

Due to COVID regulations people will not be able to attend the hearing in person. There will be a call-in number where the public can listen to the hearing. Stay tuned for this number. We will also be holding a rally and press conference prior to the hearings at 8am outside the Alfred J. Arraj United States Courthouse (901 19th St - 20th and Champa) with safe distancing measures in place.

See More

entry.content:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

THREE Sweeps Next Week - Pushing the Same People Block to Block...

A THIRD sweep is scheduled for next week. 7th and Lincoln is now scheduled for a sweep on Thursday December 10th. That makes three sweeps next week. The City is clearly trying to get as many sweeps as possible in before our lawsuit hearing the following week.

21st,20th, Market, Blake and Wazee from 22nd to Park Ave is scheduled for Wednesday, December 9th. This encampment made up of people who were swept fro...m 22nd and Wazze a couple weeks ago and from Arkins this week. Now the City plans to sweep them again...to some other block to be swept again...

13th and Elati is also posted for a sweep next Tuesday, December 8th. This camp has roughly 50 people and is about half made up of people who moved there from the downtown library sweep a couple weeks ago.

Please come and support our unhoused community members at 13th and Elati on Tuesday, 21st and Market and Blake on Wednesday, and 7th and Lincoln on Thursday as they demand real housing or places where they are allowed to survive.

Bring the following things to assist residents:

-Truck, or any vehicle to help move

-Carts

-Bungee Cords

-Rope

-Trash Bags

-Food

-Coffee/CoCo

-Water

Your assistance is much appreciated! Somewhere around 6:30am and all morning help will likely be needed.

Toward Rights, Dignity and Housing…

entry.title: Update from Day Two of Arkins Sweep, Camping Ban Harassment,...
entry.content:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

Update from Day Two of Arkins Sweep,
Camping Ban Harassment, and
Coming Sweep at 13th and Elati

Today was the second day of sweeps at the Arkins encampment. Last night residents of the camp were told they could not get back into their property - some slept right outside the fence with what they had. Others scattered to who knows where without their property. Others were told they could go in, but if they came back out they could not get back in to get the rest of their prop...erty. In the morning, starting around 6am, the City started trashing property - indiscriminately scooping property with bulldozers and bobcats and crains. Anyone who had their property there but was not allowed in lost all their property. One of the only people who got their property today was a woman we helped get back in to get her stuff just before they were about to trash it.

After the sweep today, police went to numerous other camps around town - many where residents from Arkins moved to - telling them they could not be there under camping ban enforcement. People trying to move from the Arkins sweep were stopped from setting up at various camps - including cops threatening volunteers helping folks move with “illegal dumping” if they unloaded the person’s property.

On top of all this, 13th and Elati was just posted for a sweep next Tuesday, December 8th. This camp has roughly 50 people and is about have way made up of people who moved from their from the downtown library sweep a couple weeks ago.

This shit must end.

Contact:
info@denverhomelessoutloud.org
720-940-5291

See More

entry.title: DPD Always ready to escalate to a fight how about learning to...
entry.content:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

DPD Always ready to escalate to a fight how about learning to deescalate situations for a change. Yesterday they arrested someone while they were praying claiming they were failing to comply with a "lawful" order.

Stupid is as stupid does.

Lisa Calderon is with Jeff Fard and Candi CdeBaca.

"This is where the cops told us we would be okay, and apparently we're not going to be okay."
~ Thomas Bevington, 29th & Arkins
Westword (Photos: ET Tafoya & DHOL)

entry.title: "The city does offer storage for belongings, including...
entry.content:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

"The city does offer storage for belongings, including those that appear left behind. But the simple presence of a needle justifies the disposal of a tent, according to city guidelines"
------------
The guidelines also state they can throw a tent away for the simple appearance partially eaten food left in a tent. Almost every tent will have a half eaten sandwich or other food they were saving for later. It gives the city an excuse to toss everything with out looking very har...d. So why would they substitute a referee to something that everyone does – eat food- with something a small minority of people do – intravenous drugs-. I will offer that they are trying to shame these folks in any way possible so you (the general public) allow their cruelty to these people.

BTW after contacting 100 people no one was housed. (or they would be declaring it and bragging about how many they housed) One person we are aware of got a 72 hour hotel voucher. They will be on the street in a couple of days.

Offering services is different than meeting needs.

https://www.westword.com/…/denver-sweeps-homeless-encampmen…

See MoreDenver police officers fenced off the area to prevent protesters from entering the encampment.

westword.com

Denver Begins Sweep of Large Homeless Encampment in RiNo

Denver police officers fenced off the area to prevent protesters from entering the encampment.Denver police officers fenced off the area to prevent protesters from entering the encampment.
